text:

name: NewYorker
text: Donald Trump “appears to be living a politician’s dream: a Presidency free of consequence and devoid of accountability,” @sbg1 writes. “What this means for the nation, for American democracy, is a different issue altogether.” https://t.co/a7FZuxXFMR

name: NewYorker
text: Witnesses say that a Mister Softee ice-cream truck plowed through wooden barricades in Brooklyn—and struck again and again.  https://t.co/oCFOLF0Qdj

name: NewYorker
text: Recent poll findings suggest President Trump is still confronting the same basic challenge that the Republican Party faced in the 2018 midterms: a majority of voters don’t like the President or approve of the job he is doing. https://t.co/w4osUB94Pd

name: NewYorker
text: In "I'm Thinking of Ending Things," Charlie Kaufman seeks admiration for his warmhearted humanism and also for his extravagant creativity, even when the latter gets in the way of the former, @tnyfrontrow writes. https://t.co/NiGp6lvsSp

name: NewYorker
text: “Currents explained Louisa’s father’s body’s disappearance. Shock explained Louisa’s transposition to the sand. All of it was sad. None of it was surprising.” A short story by Susan Choi. https://t.co/pelI1yTGC3

name: NewYorker
text: .@rachsyme profiles Mario Dedivanovic, who has spent 12 years painting the face of Kim Kardashian West, and whose well-known live workshops cost aspiring makeup artists as much as $1,700 to attend. https://t.co/kUZvd07Iuq

name: NewYorker
text:
“You can’t practice social distancing if you have 35 to 40 people crammed into the back of a 40-foot bus,” a veteran bus driver says. “We’re sitting on a simmering pot here.”
https://t.co/AOhTOYXkhV

name: NewYorker
text: The posthuman future has never been easier to imagine—especially for those who work at the forefront of technology. https://t.co/pZRPvYzDjx

name: NewYorker
text: Through impeachment and scandal and now pandemic and recession, a more or less straight line of roughly 40 per cent of Americans have supported President Trump. https://t.co/4syNTttqHl

name: NewYorker
text: In the U.S., insurers don’t pay for testing that they don’t consider medically necessary. Yet testing people who don’t have symptoms is crucial to getting COVID-19 under control. https://t.co/Ybr7DBBHda

name: NewYorker
text: As the hours spent at home increase, the number of people from high school suddenly reaching out rises exponentially. https://t.co/P0Gk0qdxc8

name: NewYorker
text: "People are angry about being unemployed, about having to close their businesses—I understand that,” a Michigan state representative said. “But there are elements, extremists, who are using this as an opportunity to ignite hate." https://t.co/InecrgTJKO

name: NewYorker
text: In 2017, a beaked whale washed up onshore near Bergen, Norway. In its stomach were some 30 pieces of plastic trash, including Ukrainian chicken packaging, a Danish ice-cream wrapper, and a British potato-chip bag. https://t.co/RL7QGGLWDK
